short_summary: The Department of Fisheries and Oceans, Canada, requires the professional services for two Intermediate Consultants Stream 5.0 Technical Engineering and Maintenance Services Stream, Category 5.3 Engineering Graduate to provide technical assistance and support to the Canadian Coast Guard, Vessel Life Extension (VLE) program. The resource requirement is intended to facilitate and enhance CCG procurement and program management practices in identifying, defining and developing comprehensive work plans. The primary resource role will be to define and draft work plans/specifications for individual and concurrent ship repair projects, while complying with Canadian procurement, contracting laws and CCG policies. The work will be coordinated, planned, and executed by the VLE group across the country, working closely with other sections of the CCG and ITS branch. The scope of work includes reviewing technical reports, conducting technical research and data gathering, and developing quality assurance plans and checklists.
description: The contract period will be from contract award to approximately July 10, 2023. , The primary resource role will be to define and draft work plans/specifications for individual and concurrent ship repair projects, while complying with Canadian procurement, contracting laws and CCG policies. full_summary:
**Technical Services and Engineering Consulting Services**
=========================
### Contract Details
#### Solicitation Number
30002416-1

#### Contract Description
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada is soliciting bids for Technical Services and Engineering Consulting Services to support the Canadian Coast Guard's Vessel Life Extension program.

#### Tender Closing Date
2023-04-12, 14:00:00

#### Expected Contract Start Date
2023-04-24

#### Expected Contract End Date
2023-07-10

#### Procurement Method
Competitive

#### Trade Agreements
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement

#### Regions of Opportunity
* British Columbia

#### Regions of Delivery
* British Columbia

### Service Details
The contract requires the successful bidder to provide technical assistance and support to the Canadian Coast Guard's Vessel Life Extension program. The bidder will be responsible for developing work plans and specifications for individual and concurrent ship repair projects, as well as conducting quality assurance and acceptance trials.

### Mandatory Requirements
* Applicants must be a qualified TSPS Supply Arrangement Holder
* The bidder must have expertise in technical engineering and maintenance services
* The bidder must be able to provide support to the assigned project team
* The bidder must be able to conduct quality assurance and acceptance trials

### Contact Information
For inquiries regarding this solicitation, please contact:
Ashley Potter
Contracting Officer
E-mail: [ashley.potter@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:ashley.potter@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)
Phone: 613-432-1855

### Important Notes
* The Task and Solutions Professional Services (TSPS) Method of Supply is subject to quarterly refresh cycles.
* Documents may be submitted in either official language.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.
